category.term: 71~Stephanie Woods~Maybelline Beauty Products~Kim D'Amato~Lancome Beauty Products
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Now that the sweltering summer heat is here, we’re on a hunt for that perfect waterproof mascara that won’t flake or run down our face. This week we tested some of the best – and worst – products on the market. See which ones lived up to their claims and which ones will be tossed in the trash.



Rimmel Max Waterproof Mascara (Suggested retail price: $8.99; available in select drug and mass retailers across Canada)

“My makeup style is very minimalist (I usually just wear powder, eyeshadow and mascara), so a good mascara makes a really big difference to how I look. The Max Volume Flash Mascara by Rimmel suits my needs well. Rimmel claims this mascara has their biggest brush ever, and yet it is quite simple to use. The product glided on smoothly and with a few brushstrokes, my lashes looked thicker and longer. The waterproof formula lasted a long time without smudging and didn’t leave any transfer below my eyes. The packaging is a bright pink which allowed me to easily find it in my purse. Overall it’s a really good everyday mascara – especially for the price. Rating: 4.5” - Joanne Yeung

“I’ve tried many Rimmel products before and loved them. However, I did not like this particular mascara. Even by looking at the thing brush I could tell this product would not work for me. Upon application my lashes immediately fell straight down and did not curl. I also found it to be very clumpy and some of my lashes were sticking together. However, I had this one on one day while I was packing to move and so I was constantly sweating and it did a pretty good job at not smudging. Still, I’ll stick with other Rimmel products instead. Rating: 2/5” - Kim D'Amato


Hard Candy - Big Curls Don't Cry Waterproof Mascara (Suggested retail price: $5.98; available at Wal-Mart)

“You know when you start applying your mascara, but it makes your eyelashes stick together, so you try to use the brush to separate them? And then it just leads to stickier, more stuck lashes, except with bonus mascara clumps? Um, yeah, that’s what happened. Although it can probably be blamed on my less-than-stellar mascara application skills, I prefer a product that can save me from myself. Despite the pretty tube and the bargain price, I don’t think I’d try this one again. Rating: 2/5” -Jaclyn Desforges

“I’ve never used a Hard Candy product before so I have nothing to compare it to, brand-wise. I have rather long lashes but this mascara didn’t make them pop. I found I needed to apply three coats before I could actually notice a difference. After an hour I could already notice smudging, which got worse throughout the day. The waterproof claim didn’t hold up. It was pretty easy to remove since it really wasn’t waterproof at all. The price point for this product is rather good, but I’d rather spend more money on something that is going to last. Rating: 2/5” Kim D'Amato

“This was by far the worst mascara I have ever used – period. It looked fine when I first put it on, but it didn’t make my lashes curl at all as the name would suggest. I put it on in the morning before work and by noon I had huge smudges under my eyes. (I don’t have a job that causes me to sweat, and it wasn’t raining outside.) For the rest of the day it kept falling into my eyes in chunks. I would never use this mascara again. Rating: 0/5” - Stephanie Woods

“This is a great regular mascara, but there's no way it could be classified as waterproof. The product easily washes off with soap and water. The wand picks up just enough product that there aren't issues with messy application and clumpy lashes. It actually layers on the thin side and requires a few coats to achieve the desired volume. Big Curls Don't Cry doesn't produce a noticeable curl, but it doesn't leave your lashes stiff and separated either. This product fails in the waterproof area and the cardboard tube package seems a little flimsy and may fall apart after extended use or coming into contact with water - but overall I was very pleased with how my lashes looked all day with this mascara. Rating 3.5/5” - Bonnie Large


Maybelline Falsies Flared Waterproof Mascara (Suggested retail price: $9.99; available at Drug stores and Mass retailers across Canada)

“Well done, Maybelline. Not only did this product create an over-the-top, dramatic look but it lasted throughout the day without flaking or fading. The wand added fullness without clumps and separated well. The mascara was a little difficult to remove, so it won’t become part of my daily makeup routine, but I would use it again because it did the trick in terms of volume/length. Rating 4/5” - Robyn Kelly

“With trips to the cottage, long weekends and pool parties just around the corner, my thin lashes need mascara to last through it all. Luckily, Maybelline Falsies Flared Waterproof mascara does the trick! While I didn’t feel like I fooled anyone into thinking I had lashes, the mascara did make them appear fuller without the clumping. And after a dip in the pool, the mascara stayed intact without smears or smudges. I’d definitely wear it again but without a great eye-makeup remover, it’s a pain to take off. Rating: 4/5” -- Laura Catania

“This is a terrible mascara! The wand holds too much product making application messy and my lashes so clumpy and mashed together I had to take a dry makeup comb to even them out. There isn't a very noticeable 'scoop' to the spoon curler compared to the generous illustration on the package. The mascara is indeed very waterproof which is great but also makes it very hard to take remove. This mascara weighed down my lashes, took too long to apply and fix clumps and didn’t significantly curl my lashes for the false lash effect. As well as poor product performance, PETA claims Maybelline tests their products on animals which may be a deciding factor for some customers when comparing with other brands. Rating 0/5” - Bonnie Large


The Body Shop Big & Curvy Waterproof Mascara (Suggested retail price: $18; available at The Body Shop)

“The Body Shop brand was my favourite of the bunch. Once I got over the slightly weird smell (not that most mascara smells like roses, anyway) I noticed how smoothly it goes on. The tiny little brush managed to coat lashes I didn’t know I had, and it only took a couple of swipes to get dramatic results. Clump-free and easy to remove, I’d definitely give this product another try. Rating: 4/5” -Jaclyn Desforges

“Big and curvy? Not so much. This mascara didn’t do much in the way of amping up my lashes, but as a subtle, everyday mascara it was fine – and it certainly didn’t smudge. As a matter of fact, it didn’t want to come off at all, even with eye makeup remover. Rating: 2/5” – Jen McDonnell

"With the weather getting warmer and wedding season in full swing, I was excited to try out this waterproof mascara. I have long, dark, straight eyelashes that could use a little curl. The brush didn’t seem like other curling mascaras I’ve used; it was long and thin and not curved, and so I was a little skeptical. I did like the fact that it’s a fibre brush and not plastic. I wore this mascara to a wedding. It rained and I cried, and it stayed in place beautifully with no running or smudging. I would give it 10 out of 10 for its waterproof ability. It also curled my lashes and made them look a lot longer. It did clump a little when applying, but a lash brush helped separate my lashes. For the price, I’d give this one a try. Rating: 4.5/5” - Jenna Downing


Bourjois Paris Liner Effect Waterproof Mascara (Suggested retail price: $20; available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“The wand on this one really does allow you to get right in there and apply it from the very base of your lid, thus the promised ‘liner effect.’ I really liked this one for the price; I’m not sure I achieved the “perfect, doe-eyed look” like the packaging claims (no one’s going to mistake me for Zooey Deschanel anytime soon), but the mascara was non-clumpy and the effect was dramatic enough. Rating: 4/5” – Jen McDonnell

“Full disclosure: I’m usually not a fan of waterproof mascara. I’d rather risk raccoon eyes than deal with that dry, crunchy, there’s-no-way-I’m-ever-scraping-this-gunk-off feeling that typically comes along with waterproof varieties. In spite of my bias, the Bourjois Paris brand actually impressed me - at first. Its skinny little brush is flexible, and the application was relatively clump-free. While it didn’t compare to my favourite non-waterproof brand in terms of drama, my lashes were indeed lengthened and stayed that way all day. I thought the removal was easy enough, until I woke up to see the leftover mascara that had travelled down my face overnight. I’d try it again, but do a better job with the makeup remover next time! Rating: 3/5” -Jaclyn Desforges

“I don’t normally wear mascara since my lashes are pretty long to begin with and it’s been a long tough fight trying to find a mascara that curls and thickens my lashes, but right from the start I loved this product. The wand’s bristles are long and thin, which makes application quite easy for upper and lower lashes. My lashes looked fuller, didn’t clump together and remained fairly curled throughout the day. By the end of the day there was no smudging and when it came time to wash my face it took a bit of scrubbing and some makeup remover to completely get it off, but that is what makes for a good waterproof mascara. I will definitely use this product again. Rating: 5/5” - Kim D'Amato

“This particular waterproof product was the best I’ve tried for durability. This mascara could easily stay on without running for days although it did little in terms of volume or length. It separated the lashes well and went on incredibly smooth. I would use it again if was going to be outside the entire day. Rating 3/5” - Robyn Kelly

“I was impressed with this mascara because the wand separated my lashes perfectly. There’s nothing worse than then chunky lashes! It lasted all day and because it is waterproof, it was a bit difficult to remove with regular removal cream. With the right waterproof remover, I would definitely continue using this product. For $10 less than the Lancôme mascara, this is clearly the better buy. Rating: 4/5” - Jennifer Simone


Givenchy Phenomen'Eyes Waterproof (Suggested retail price: $33; available at Sephora)

“It’s not often that a mascara wins me over before I even touch the brush to my lashes, but Givenchy’s Phenomen’Eyes gets instant points for the packaging alone. Not only is it topped by a pretty silver cap, but it’s shorter and thicker than most mascara tubes, making it extra compact and purse-ready. Even better, the mascara itself actually delivers. The cool wand (shaped like a ball instead of the typical stick) was able to reach every lash – even the tiny ones in the corners – to really make my eyes pop. My lashes looked dramatically longer, and the mascara didn’t budge all day. Rating: 5/5” – Jen McDonnell

“I had very mixed feelings about this mascara. I loved the small ball-shaped wand – it made application really easy and my lashes didn’t clump at all. It also made my lashes look super long and still very natural. However, I don’t think this product is as waterproof as it claims to be. After going for a run my eyes had smudges underneath them, and I was able to remove most of the mascara by just rinsing my face with water. I didn’t even need to use eye makeup remover. I would use this mascara again because I loved the look it achieved – but not in a situation where I need it to be waterproof. Rating: 3/5” - Stephanie Woods


Définicils Waterproof High Definition Mascara (Suggested retail price: $31; available at all Lancôme counters and on Lancôme.ca)

“This mascara really defined my lashes and made them super long. It will withstand any amount of water – and also makeup remover. I had a really hard time getting this mascara off! I would definitely wear this swimming, because I would not be worried about it coming off. But for everyday life, I think it’s a bit too heavy duty. Rating: 4/5” - Stephanie Woods

“Lancôme’s Definicils Waterproof Mascara is truly waterproof! It was very difficult to take off, which could be a good thing when going to the beach or swimming at the cottage. It was smooth and creamy when applied and lasted all day. It is pricier than the mascara I would normally buy but you are paying for the quality. I would definitely use it again when I go away somewhere. Rating: 4.5/5” -Yvonne Yip

“I like the long, sleek look of the packaging and the wand, which is very easy to pop into a makeup bag. Nevertheless, I had to go over my lashes about 3 times to avoid chunky, stuck together lashes. This mascara is long lasting – a little too long lasting, because I had a hard time removing it at night. I would really only use this mascara if I was going swimming, because I would be confident it would not run. Rating: 2/5” -Jennifer Simone


L’Oreal Voluminous Million Lashes Waterproof (Suggested retail price: $10.99; available at Drug stores and Mass retailers across Canada)

“This was my favourite mascara of the four I tested. The rubber wand made application a breeze, and my lashes were long and separated and fabulous. It was also very waterproof – it stayed on through a workout in the heat without smudging at all. It was also easy to take off using the same make-up removing cloths I use to remove my regular mascara. I would definitely use this product again. Rating: 5/5” - Stephanie Woods

“I’d been considering trying a new mascara so I was excited to have the opportunity to review this product. The gold-coloured tube makes it look more expensive than it is. When I first pulled the wand out of the tube I encountered some resistance, which I realized after examining the package is due to a constriction near the mouth of the tube intended to remove any excess product. I was concerned at first that the very thick wand would make application difficult, but it didn’t seem to cause any problems. I did like the rubber material the bristles were made of, as I felt they separated the lashes better than a wire brush. The mascara gave my lashes definition that lasted well through the evening. I was easily able to remove the product with my usual makeup removing cloths. Although I didn’t notice anything miraculous about this product, it is a good, solid everyday mascara that I would definitely use again. Rating: 4/5” -Jennifer Stein

source.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Waterproof Mascara
